meanings.definition: To score or mark in advance
meanings.sent1: The teacher prescored the test to save time during class.
meanings.sent2: I prescored the soccer game in my head before it even started.
meanings.sent3: The squirrel prescored the best acorn in the tree for later.
meanings.sent4: Her intuition prescored the outcome of the meeting before it began.
meanings.sent5: The detective's keen eye prescored the suspect's guilt before any evidence was presented.

meanings.definition: Having been scored or marked in advance
meanings.sent1: The prescored answer key made grading the tests much quicker.
meanings.sent2: The prescored lines on the paper helped the students write neatly.
meanings.sent3: The prescored trail markers guided us through the forest effortlessly.
meanings.sent4: The prescored map led us to the hidden treasure without any confusion.
meanings.sent5: The prescored music sheets allowed the musicians to play in perfect harmony.
